definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Manufacturer of electronic musical instruments and digital recording products.
sentences.chinese: 製造業者電子的音樂樂器和數位錄音的產品。

sentences.english: You should know the manufacturer, model number, and capacity of the drive.
sentences.chinese: 你應該知道磁盤的製造業者，樣板的數目和容量。

sentences.english: Manufacturers of innovative and powerful outboard gear for recording.
sentences.chinese: 製造業者創新的和有力的外側爲記錄以齒輪連起。
高結束外側的齒輪製造業者。

sentences.english: We purchase aluminium ingot from one of the top ten aluminium manufacturers in China.
sentences.chinese: 我們購買來自中國的前十名鋁製造業者之一的鋁錠。

sentences.english: The supplier shall define and document how the requirements for quality shall be met.
sentences.chinese: 製造業者應明文規定如何達成質量要求。

sentences.english: All of the major automotive manufacturers now use this technique.
sentences.chinese: 所有主要的汽車製造業者現在都使用這種技術。

sentences.english: Manufacturers of electronic violins, cellos and basses .
sentences.chinese: 電子的小提琴，大提琴和低音的製造業者。
